com.hissain.jscipy

Class Math

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.Math

  • public class Math
extends java.lang.Object
    A facade class providing static utility methods for mathematical operations. This class delegates to specific implementations within the library.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Math()

    • Method Detail

      • resample

        public static double[] resample(double[] x,
                                int num)
        Resamples x to num samples using Fourier method along the given axis.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        num - The number of samples in the resampled signal.
        Returns:
        The resampled signal.

      • interp1d_linear

        public static double[] interp1d_linear(double[] x,
                                       double[] y,
                                       double[] newX)
        Performs linear interpolation on the given data points.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.

      • interp1d_cubic

        public static double[] interp1d_cubic(double[] x,
                                      double[] y,
                                      double[] newX)
        Performs cubic spline interpolation on the given data points.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.

      • interp1d_quadratic

        public static double[] interp1d_quadratic(double[] x,
                                          double[] y,
                                          double[] newX)
        Performs quadratic spline interpolation on the given data points. Matches SciPy's interp1d(kind='quadratic') using B-splines.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.

      • interp1d_bspline

        public static double[] interp1d_bspline(double[] x,
                                        double[] y,
                                        double[] newX,
                                        int k)
        Performs B-spline interpolation of arbitrary degree.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        k - The degree of the spline.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.

      • polyfit

        public static double[] polyfit(double[] x,
                               double[] y,
                               int degree)
        Least squares polynomial fit. Fits a polynomial p(x) = p[0] * x**deg + ... + p[deg] of degree deg to points (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinates of the sample points.
        y - y-coordinates of the sample points.
        degree - Degree of the fitting polynomial.
        Returns:
        Polynomial coefficients, highest power first.

      • polyval

        public static double[] polyval(double[] p,
                               double[] x)
        Evaluate a polynomial at specific values.
        Parameters:
        p - Polynomial coefficients (highest degree first).
        x - Points at which to evaluate.
        Returns:
        Evaluated values.

      • polyval

        public static double polyval(double[] p,
                             double x)
        Evaluate a polynomial at a specific value.
        Parameters:
        p - Polynomial coefficients (highest degree first).
        x - Point at which to evaluate.
        Returns:
        Evaluated value.

      • polyder

        public static double[] polyder(double[] p)
        Compute the derivative of a polynomial.
        Parameters:
        p - Polynomial coefficients (highest degree first).
        Returns:
        Derivative polynomial coefficients.
